</EFX_MARKET>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Item 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10.8PT 0PT 0PT 3.6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:10.75PT;TEXT-INDENT:32.4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The following discussion of our financial condition and results of operations should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and the notes thereto included elsewhere in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	annual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	port on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition to historical condensed consolidated financial information, the following discussion contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. See &#x201C;Cautionary Note About Forward-Looking Statements&#x201D; included elsewhere in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	annual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	eport on Form 10-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We own or lease and operate 14 ski resorts throughout the Midwestern, Northeastern and Southeastern U.S. Our ski resorts, which include both day ski resorts and overnight drive ski resorts, offer snow skiing, snowboarding and other snow sports. During the last two ski seasons, we had an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	1.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	skier visits each year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We and our subsidiaries operate in a single business segment&#x2014;resort operations. The consolidated financial data for our fiscal years ended April 30,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014 presented in this annual report is comprised of the data of our 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ski resorts. Also included in the financial information presented are ancillary services, primarily consisting of food and beverage services, equipment rental, ski instruction, hotel/lodging and retail.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The opening and closing dates of our ski resorts are dependent upon weather conditions, but our peak ski season generally runs from early December to mid-April. See Item 1, &#x201C;Business&#x2014;Seasonality&#x201D; for an illustration of the opening and closing dates for the 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	through 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ski seasons for our 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ski resorts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We, like other day ski resort and overnight drive ski resort operators, earn our revenues in six principal categories. In order of their contribution, they are: lift
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and tubing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	tickets, food and beverage sales, equipment rentals, ski instruction, hotel/lodging, and retail. For more detailed information about each revenue category, see "Business&#x2014;Revenue Components."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our single largest source of revenue is the sale of lift tickets (including season passes) which represented approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	47.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	48.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	49.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% of net revenue for fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, respectively. Lift ticket revenue is driven by the volume of lift tickets and season passes sold and the pricing of these items. Most of our season pass products are sold before the start of the ski season. Season pass revenue, although collected prior to the ski season, is recognized in the consolidated statement of earnings (loss) over the ski season based upon the estimated length of the season. For the 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ski seasons, approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	38.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	29.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	28.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	%, respectively, of total lift revenue recognized was comprised of season pass revenue. There can be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	no assurance that future season pass sales will be similar to historical trends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The cost structure of our operations has a significant fixed component with variable expenses including, but not limited to, retail and food and beverage cost of sales, labor, power and utilities. As such, profit margins can fluctuate based on the level of revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Seasonality and Quarterly Results
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	32
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our resort operations are seasonal in nature. In particular, revenue and profits for our operations are substantially lower and historically result in losses from late spring to late fall, which occur during our first and second fiscal quarters. Revenue and profits generated by our summer operations are not sufficient to fully offset our off-season expenses from our operations. During fiscal 2016 and 2015, 88.3% and 89.0%, respectively, of resort revenues were recognized in the third and fourth fiscal quarters. Therefore, the operating results for any interim period are not necessarily indicative of the results that may be achieved for any subsequent quarter or for a full year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recent Trends
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The timing and duration of favorable weather conditions impact our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	revenues in regard to the timing and number of skier visits. Though the amount of snowfall early in the ski season does encourage skier visits, all of our ski resorts have snowmaking capabilities in the event that the natural snowfall is insufficient. Cold weather, however, is essential to a successful ski season. There is no way to predict favorable weather conditions in the future. We sell season passes prior to the start of the ski season to help mitigate any negative effects that unfavorable weather may have on our revenues.&nbsp;&nbsp;Driven by the positive response for the newly introduced Peak Pass product
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the 2016/2017 season
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, overall unit presales were up 40 percent, compared to the prior year, resulting in pass-related deferred revenue growth of 29 percent over the same time period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e faced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	significant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	weather challenges during the 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ski season due to unseasonably warm weather in the Midwest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the Northeast.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Early season warm weather significantly impacted our Christmas season. The warmer weather continued throughout the season causing lower visits. The acquisition of Hunter Mountain in January 2016 mitigated the impact.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	iscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Reported EBITDA was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	16.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	down $9.2 million from fiscal 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and revenue for fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was down
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$9.1 million from fiscal 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Though we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	have increased the prices of most of our lift tickets, passes and other products and services in each of the last two ski seasons, there can be no assurance that we will be able to increase prices in the future or predict the impact that pricing increases may have on visitation or revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our skier visits of 1.2 million in fiscal 2016 were down 25.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from fiscal 2015. This compares to a 28.1% decrease in total U.S. skier visits to Northeast resorts and a 16.7% decrease in total U.S. skier visits to Midwest resorts reported by the NSAA&#x2019;s Kottke National End Season Survey 2015/2016 Preliminary Report. Our total resort visits, which include tube visits, were down 23.6% from fiscal 2015. Total visits to our Northeast resorts were down from 1.07 million in fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to 0.85 million in fiscal 2016. Total visits to our Midwest resorts decreased from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.64 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in fiscal 2014 to 0.45 million in fiscal 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Total visits during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Christmas
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were down from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.08
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, due to the adverse weather impacting the Christmas holiday period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at our Midwest resorts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Total visits other than during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	holiday
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	periods (Christmas, MLK Weekend and President&#x2019;s Weekend)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	down
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to 0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	96
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, season
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	pass holder visits decreased from 0.60 million in fiscal 2015 to 0.41in fiscal 2016, while pay-per-visit total visits decreased from 0.95 million in 2015 to 0.76 million in fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The warm weather continued into the early spring ski season affecting visits. March and April visits were 0.15 million in fiscal 2016 down from 0.33 million in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recent Events
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Financing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	/Liquidity
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has experienced lower than normal liquidity levels as of the end of fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The weather during the ski season was unfavorably warm which resulted in fewer ski days and lower profitability for the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the Company is still waiting on the first investor&#x2019;s approval with regards to our approved EB-5 program.&nbsp;&nbsp;In anticipation of the EB-5 approval, which would release all funds from escrow
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and allow those funds to spend on project related activies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the company has spent more than $13 million of our working capital on starting the West Lake Construction project
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which is part of the overall Mt. Snow Development Project
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company received approval for a $10 million short term financing option which would provide additional liquidity until the start of our 2016/2017 ski season.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has not yet executed the loan, as we continue to wait for EB-5 approval.&nbsp;&nbsp;If EB-5 is not approved in the next few months, the Company will need to execute on this loan.&nbsp;&nbsp;The board made the decision in April 2016 that it would not be prudent to declare a dividend due
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to lower cash levels primarily caused by the delay in the approval of our EB-5 program
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, as well as the unseasonably warm weather during the 2015/2016 ski season which drove down revenue compared to the prior season
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In addition, the Master Credit Agreement includes financial covenants consisting of a maximum Leverage Ratio (as defined in the Master Credit Agreement) of 65%, above which the Company and certain of its subsidiaries are prohibited from incurring additional indebtedness, and a Consolidated Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio (as defined in the Master Credit Agreement) covenant, which (a)&nbsp;requires the Company to increase the balance of its debt service reserve account if the Company's Consolidated Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio falls below 1.50:1.00, and (b)&nbsp;prohibits the Company from paying dividends if the ratio is below 1.25:1.00. As of our most recent fiscal year end, our fixed charge ratio fell below the 1:50:1:00 coverage ratio, but was above the 1.25:1.00 ratio.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, the Company must increase the balance of its debt service
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	33
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reserve by $3.3 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;EPR has agreed to defer the payment of the reserve until the end of the 2016/2017 ski season.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company continues to explore financing options to fund short and long-term capital needs.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The company has received approval for a $10 million short term financing option, if needed, to assist with the remainder of our summer season if our EB-5 projects first investor approval is not received in the near term.&nbsp; The board made the decision April 2016 that it would not be prudent to declare a dividend due lower cash levels of the company due to the delay in approval our EB-5 program.&nbsp; In addition, the company is also working on evaluating various alternatives, to assist with our long term liquidity.&nbsp; Please refer below in the MD&amp;A section for more specific information on our liquidity, the EB-5 program, and the West Lake construction project.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Resort Acquisition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On January 6, 2016, the Company completed the acquisition of the Hunter Mountain ski resort located in Hunter, New York, through the purchase of all of the outstanding stock of each of Hunter Mountain Ski Bowl, Inc., Hunter Mountain Festivals, Ltd., Hunter Mountain Rentals, Inc., Hunter Resort Vacations, Inc., Hunter Mountain Base Lodge, Inc., and Frosty Land, Inc. pursuant to the terms of the Purchase Agreement entered into on November 30, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company acquired Hunter Mountain for total cash consideration of $35.0 million plus the assumption of two capital leases estimated at approximately $1.7 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A portion of the Hunter Mountain acquisition price was financed pursuant to the Hunter Mountain Credit Agreement, and the remainder was financed with funds drawn on the Company&#x2019;s Line of Credit Agreement with Royal Banks of Missouri. See &#x201C;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#x2014;Significant Sources of Cash&#x201D; for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have included Hunter Mountain&#x2019;s results of operations in our financial statements since the date of acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Initial Public Offering and Debt Restructure
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During fiscal 2015, we completed the initial public offering of our common stock, selling 10,000,000 shares at $9.00 per share. After deducting $6.3 million of underwriting discounts and commissions and $1.4 million of offering expenses payable by us, we received net proceeds of $82.3 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;With the proceeds from the offering, we (i) repaid approximately $75.8 million of our outstanding debt; (ii) paid approximately $0.4 million to acquire the portion of the land underlying Crotched Mountain that we previously leased; and (iii) paid a defeasance fee to our lender of $5.0 million in connection with the prepayment of a portion of our debt. We used the remaining proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On November 10, 2014, in connection with our initial public offering, we entered into a Restructure Agreement EPR, our primary lender, providing for the Debt Restructure as follows: (i) prepayment of approximately $75.8 million of formerly non-prepayable debt secured by the Crotched Mountain, Attitash, Paoli Peaks, Hidden Valley and Snow Creek resorts with proceeds from our in initial public offering; and (ii) retirement of one of the notes associated with the future development of Mount Snow. On December 1, 2014, we entered into various agreements in order to effectuate the Debt Restructure.&nbsp;&nbsp;See &#x201C;&#x2014;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#x2014;Significant Sources of Cash&#x201D; for a more detailed description of the Debt Restructure and related documents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In exchange for the prepayment right, we granted EPR a purchase option on the Boston Mills, Brandywine, Jack Frost, Big Boulder and Alpine Valley properties, subject to certain conditions.&nbsp;&nbsp;If EPR exercises a purchase option, EPR will enter into an agreement with the Company for the lease of each such acquired property for an initial term of 20 years, plus options to extend the lease for two additional periods of ten years each. All previously existing option agreements between the Company and EPR were terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Additionally, we agreed to extend the maturity dates on all non-prepayable notes and mortgages secured by the Mount Snow, Boston Mills, Brandywine, Jack Frost, Big Boulder and Alpine Valley properties remaining after the Debt Restructure by seven years to December 1, 2034, and to extend the lease for the Mad River property, previously terminating in 2026, until December 31, 2034.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We also granted EPR a right of first refusal to provide all or a portion of the financing associated with any purchase, ground lease, sale/leaseback, management or financing transaction contemplated by the Company with respect to any new or existing ski resort property for a period of seven years or until financing provided by EPR for such transactions equals or exceeds $250 million in the aggregate. Proposed financings from certain types of institutional lenders providing a loan to value ratio of less than 60% (as relates to the applicable property being financed) are excluded from the right of first refusal. We granted EPR a separate right of first refusal in the event that the Company wishes to sell, transfer, convey or otherwise dispose of any or all of the Attitash ski resort for seven years.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Attitash right excludes the financing or mortgaging of Attitash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	34
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the Debt Restructure, we entered into a Master Credit and Security Agreement with EPR containing additional terms and conditions governing our restructure debt with EPR, including restrictions on certain transactions and the payment of dividends and required financial covenants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Capital Projects
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We had one major capital project in fiscal 2016. We started the construction of the West
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;L
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ake project which will be financed through the EB-5 program, once our first investor is approved.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;The West Lake project includes the construction of a new water storage reservoir for snowmaking with capacity of up to 120 million gallons.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We had three major capital projects in fiscal 2015. We replaced aging and inefficient snow making equipment at our Attitash, Mount Snow and Wildcat resorts with new high efficiency equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We had one major capital project in fiscal 2014. At Alpine Valley in Ohio, we replaced the pump house and maintenance buildings, significantly improved our snowmaking capacity and improved our uphill capacity with the addition of two ski lifts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10.5PT 0PT 0PT 3.6PT;LINE-HEIGHT:10.75PT;TEXT-INDENT:32.4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.00%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have chosen to specifically include Reported EBITDA (defined as net income before interest, income taxes, depreciation and amortization, gain on sale leaseback, investment income, other income or expense and other non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#8209;recurring items) as a measurement of our results of operations because we consider this measurement to be a significant indication of our financial performance and available capital resources.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because of large depreciation and other charges relating to our ski resorts, it is difficult for management to fully and accurately evaluate our financial results and available capital resources using net income. Management believes that by providing investors with Reported EBITDA, investors will have a clearer understanding of our financial performance and cash flow because Reported EBITDA: (i)&nbsp;is widely used in the ski industry to measure a company&#x2019;s operating performance without regard to items excluded from the calculation of such measure, which can vary by company primarily based upon the structure or existence of their financing; (ii)&nbsp;helps investors to more meaningfully evaluate and compare the results of our operations from period to period by removing the effect of our capital structure and asset base from our operating structure; and (iii)&nbsp;is used by our management for various purposes, including as a measure of performance of our operating entities and as a basis for planning.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	36
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Items excluded from Reported EBITDA are significant components in understanding and assessing financial performance or liquidity. Reported EBITDA should not be considered in isolation or as alternative to, or substitute for, net income, net change in cash and cash equivalents or other financial statement data presented in the consolidated financial statements as indicators of financial performance or liquidity. Because Reported EBITDA is not a measurement determined in accordance with GAAP and is susceptible to varying calculations, Reported EBITDA as presented may not be comparable to other similarly titled measures of other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comparison of Operating Results for the Years ended April 30, 2016 and 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Lift and tubing revenue decreased $5.3&nbsp;million, or 10.4%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Season pass sales and seasonal program sales decreased $0.6&nbsp;million, or 3.5%, from fiscal 2015 to fiscal 2016. The decrease in lift and tubing revenue relates primarily to the decrease in skier visits. The decrease was mitigated by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Food and beverage revenue decreased $3.1&nbsp;million, or 16.4%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which is attributable to decreased skier visits. The decrease was mitigated by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Rental revenue decreased $1.0&nbsp;million, or 12.2%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which is attributable to the decrease in resort skier visits.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease was mitigated by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Ski instruction revenue decreased $0.7&nbsp;million, or 9.1%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which is attributable to the decrease in skier visits.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	The decrease was mitigated by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Hotel and lodging revenue increased $0.3&nbsp;million, or 4.6%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which is attributable to increased summer occupancy and the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Retail revenue decreased $0.7&nbsp;million, or 13.3%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which is attributable to the decrease in skier visits.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	The decrease was mitigated by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Summer revenue increased $0.6 million, or 17.4%, for fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	, which is attributable to the first season of the zip rider at our Attitash resort.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Other revenue increased $0.6 million, or 18.8%, for fiscal 2016 versus 2015 as a result of the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Labor and labor related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	creased $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015. Labor efficiencies and reduced days of operations contributed $2.4 million in labor and expense savings. Benefits and taxes contributed another $0.7 million in savings offset by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Retail and food and beverage cost of sales decreased $1.8 million, or 18.5%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015 as a result of decreased retail and food and beverage revenue offset by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Power and utility expense decreased $0.1 million, or 1.6%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015. The decrease in operating days reduced power and utility expense by $0.8 million offset by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Other resort operating expenses increased by $0.9 million, or 5.2%, for fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015. The decrease in operating days reduced other resort operating expenses by $2.4 million offset by the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation and amortization increased $1.2 million, or 13.1%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015 as a result of assets put in service in the current fiscal year and the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	General and administrative expenses increased $0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2 &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2016 versus fiscal 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to an increase in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	corporate payroll costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Real estate and other taxes increased $0.9 million , or 5.7%, as a result of the impact of the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company settled a lawsuit during fiscal 2015 which resulted in $2.1 million of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	crease in interest expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0 &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, was a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reduced interest resulting from the pay down of debt as a part of the restructuring in December 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, $0.6 million as a result in capitalized interest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	offset by the interest on the debt related to the Hunter acquisition.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In connection with the Debt Restructure, the Company paid a $5.0 million defeasance fee to EPR in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Income tax benefit increased $1.3 million as a result of an increase in the loss before income tax expense of $2.7 million for fiscal 2016 as compared to fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comparison of Operating Results for the Years ended April 30, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Lift and tubing revenue decreased $0.9&nbsp;million, or 1.6%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Season pass sales and seasonal program sales increased $0.8&nbsp;million, or 4.5%, from fiscal 2014 to fiscal 2015. The increase in revenue from season pass and seasonal program sales was offset by a decrease of $0.2&nbsp;million in yield per skier visit and decreased revenue because of reduced visits of $1.5 million. Yield is determined by dividing lift revenue by skier visits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Food and beverage revenue increased $0.3&nbsp;million, or 1.6%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014, which is attributable to an increase in yield per skier visit of $0.5&nbsp;million, offset by decreased skier visits of $0.1 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Rental revenue decreased $0.6&nbsp;million, or 6.6%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014, which is attributable to the decrease in Midwest resort skier visits versus the increase in visits to our Northeast resorts. A higher percent of visitors to our Midwest resorts rent ski equipment compared to guests at our Northeast resorts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Ski instruction revenue increased $0.1&nbsp;million, or 1.6%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014, which is attributable to an increase in yield per skier visit of $0.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Hotel and lodging revenue increased $0.1&nbsp;million, or 1.9%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014, which is attributable to increased skier visits in the Northeast resorts and increased summer occupancy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Retail revenue increased $0.5&nbsp;million, or 9.4%, for fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014, which is attributable to an increase in yield per skier visit of $0.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Labor and labor related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	creased $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014. Labor efficiencies contributed $0.1 million in labor and labor related expense savings. Benefits and taxes contributed another $0.4 million in savings offset by $0.3 million in workman&#x2019;s compensation expense as a result of increased rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Retail and food and beverage cost of sales increased $0.4 million, or 4.9%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014 as a result of increased retail and food and beverage revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Power and utility expense decreased $1.6 million, or 18.2%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014 primarily as a result of a reduction in kilowatt hours used at our Attitash, Wildcat and Mount Snow resorts. This reduction in kilowatt hour usage is a result of the installation of energy saving snow gun technology in the current fiscal year. In addition, we were able to control peak energy usage resulting in lower per kilowatt hour rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation and amortization increased $0.3 million, or 3.2%,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014 as a result of assets put in service in the current fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	General and administrative expenses increased $0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8 &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	26.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	%, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily due to an increase in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	professional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of $0.4 million primarily
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to incremental public company expenses, $0.2 million related to an increase in salaries and related benefits and $0.2 million increase in advertising and other corporate expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company settled a lawsuit during fiscal 2015 which resulted in $2.1 million of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

	1.9
</FONT>

	million, was a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reduced interest resulting from the pay down of debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fiscal 2015 versus fiscal 2014, offset by
</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. In addition, the Company paid $0.8 million in disputed interest related to the Attitash/Mount Snow Debt discussed herein.

<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Significant Sources of Cash
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our available cash is the highest in our fourth quarter primarily due to the seasonality of our resort business.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	However, the Company has experienced lower than normal liquidity levels at the end of fiscal 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The weather during the ski season was unfavorably warm which resulted in fewer ski days and lower profitability for the Company.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We had $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of cash and cash equivalents at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 2016 compared to $16.8 million at April 30, 2015. Cash of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	10.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million was provided by operating activities during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 2016 compared to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million of cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. We generate the majority of our cash from operations during the ski season, which occurs in our third and fourth quarters. We currently anticipate that Reported EBITDA will continue to provide a significant source of our future operating cash flows.&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect that our liquidity needs for the near term and the next fiscal year will be met by continued use of operating cash flows (primarily those generated in our third and fourth fiscal quarters) and additional borrowings under our loan arrangements discussed below, as needed.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company continues to explore additional financing options to fund short and long-term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	capital needs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We conducted an offering to raise $52.0&nbsp;million to fund the Carinthia Ski Lodge Project and the West Lake Project.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of April 30, 2016, we had commitments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$52.0 million in Par
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tnership investments, all of which has been funded and is being held in escrow.&nbsp;&nbsp;Since that date, we have had 3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	investors withdraw for personal reasons, which is allowed under the program while the fund are still in escrow. &nbsp;It is the Company&#x2019;s intent to replace the withdrawn funds with funds from new investors.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are currently following up with several potential investors to replace the withdrawn funds.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company is still waiting on the first investor&#x2019;s approval with regards to our approved EB-5 program.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the first investor&#x2019;s application is approved, all of the funds will be released from escrow.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has spent more than $13 million of our working capital on starting the West Lake Construction project, which will be reimbursed to the Company once the funds are released from escrow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he company has received approval for a $10 million short term financing option, if needed, to assist with the remainder of our summer season if our EB-5 projects first investor approval is not received in the near term.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the company is also working on evaluating various alternatives to assist with our long term liquidity.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The board also made the decision April 2016 that it would not be prudent to declare a dividend due lower cash levels
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily driven by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	delay in approval
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	our EB-5 program
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as well as the unseasonably warm weather during the 2015/2016 ski season which drove down revenue compared to the prior season
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Long-term debt at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 30, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and April 30, 2015 consisted of borrowings pursuant to the loans and other credit facilities with EPR, our primary lender.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As discussed in &#x201C;Recent Events&#x201D;, in November 2014, we entered into a Restructure Agreement with EPR providing for the prepayment of a portion of our outstanding debt. Furthermore, as discussed in &#x201C;Resort Acquisition&#x201D;, we entered into the Hunter Mountain Credit Agreement in connection with our acquisition of Hunter Mountain.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have presented in the table below the borrowings at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	April 30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 2016 and April 30, 2015 (dollars in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.40%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	118,343&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0.05PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.68%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.06%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	97,569&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.70%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.30%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.46%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:27.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0.05PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
